results.name: a(n) = A000120(A122111(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
mathematica: Array[DigitCount[#, 2, 1] &@ If[# < 3, 1, Block[{k = #, m = 0}, Times @@ Power @@@ Table[k -= m; k = DeleteCases[k, 0]; {Prime@Length@k, m = Min@ k}, Length@ Union@ k]] &@ Catenate[ConstantArray[PrimePi[#1], #2] & @@@ FactorInteger@ #]] &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 31 2018, after _JungHwan Min_ at A122111 *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 30 2018
